references.reason: This paper provides a foundational result for stable fast matrix multiplication, which underpins many of the algorithms analyzed in the current work.

references.paper_title: Pseudospectral Shattering, the Sign Function, and Diagonalization in Nearly Matrix Multiplication Time
references.reason: This paper introduces new techniques for matrix diagonalization, which are crucial for solving generalized eigenvalue problems and computing spectral projectors in the current paper.

references.paper_title: Self-consistent equations including exchange and correlation effects
references.reason: This foundational paper in Density Functional Theory (DFT) provides the theoretical basis for many of the applications of generalized eigenvalue problems discussed in the current work.

references.paper_title: Accuracy and stability of numerical algorithms
references.reason: This book provides a comprehensive overview of numerical analysis and floating point arithmetic, which are essential for understanding the numerical stability of the algorithms used in the current work.

references.paper_title: Analysis of a complex of statistical variables into principal components
references.reason: This seminal paper introduced the concept of Principal Component Analysis (PCA), which is a central application of generalized eigenvalue problems and is discussed extensively in the current work.
